notes: First generation three-row midsize crossover. 2.0T four-cylinder or 3.6L VR6. Standard FWD or optional 4Motion AWD. Built on MQB platform. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Atlas article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation compact crossover on MQB platform. North American version is longer-wheelbase with optional third-row seating. 2.0L turbo four-cylinder. Standard FWD or optional 4Motion AWD. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Tiguan article, January 2025 revision.

First generation compact crossover on PQ46 platform. 2.0L turbo gasoline or 2.0L TDI diesel. Standard FWD or optional 4Motion AWD. Manual or automatic transmission. Diesel variant requires diesel-specific service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Tiguan article, January 2025 revision.

Seventh generation on MQB platform. Base 1.4T turbo four-cylinder, performance GLI with 2.0T. FWD only. Manual or automatic transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Jetta article, January 2025 revision.

Sixth generation on PQ46 platform. Multiple engine options from base 2.0L to performance GLI 2.0T. TDI diesel offered 2011-2015. FWD only. Manual, automatic or DSG transmission. TDI requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Jetta article, January 2025 revision.

North American market-specific Passat (NMS) on PQ46 platform. Multiple engine options from 2.5L I5 to 3.6L VR6. TDI diesel offered 2012-2015. FWD only. TDI requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Passat article, January 2025 revision.

Sixth generation Golf on PQ46 platform. 2.5L inline-five gasoline or 2.0L TDI diesel. FWD. Manual or automatic transmission. TDI requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

Seventh generation Golf on MQB platform. 1.8L turbo gasoline or 2.0L TDI diesel. FWD. Manual or automatic transmission. TDI offered 2015 only. TDI requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

Sixth generation performance hatchback. 2.0L turbo four-cylinder with 200 hp. FWD. Manual or DSG dual-clutch transmission. Available as 2-door or 4-door. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

Seventh generation performance hatchback on MQB platform. 2.0L turbo four-cylinder with 210-220 hp. FWD. Manual or DSG dual-clutch transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

High-performance Golf R with 2.0L turbo four-cylinder producing 256 hp. Standard 4Motion AWD. Manual or DSG dual-clutch transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

High-performance Golf R on MQB platform. 2.0L turbo four-cylinder with 292 hp. Standard 4Motion AWD. Manual or DSG dual-clutch transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

All-electric Golf with 35.8 kWh lithium-ion battery (24.2 kWh 2015-2016). Electric motor produces 115 hp. FWD. Requires EV-certified technicians for high-voltage system service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen e-Golf article, January 2025 revision.

Modern reinterpretation of classic Beetle (A5 generation). Multiple engine options from 2.5L I5 to turbo 2.0T. TDI diesel offered 2013-2015. FWD. Available as hatchback or convertible. TDI requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Beetle article, January 2025 revision.

Four-door fastback sedan based on Passat platform. 2.0T turbo four-cylinder or 3.6L VR6. Standard FWD or optional 4Motion AWD (VR6 only). Manual, automatic or DSG transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen CC article, January 2025 revision.

Premium fastback sedan replacing CC. 2.0L turbo four-cylinder. Standard FWD or optional 4Motion AWD. Built on MQB platform. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Arteon article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation midsize luxury SUV. 3.6L VR6 gasoline or 3.0L TDI V6 diesel. Standard 4Motion AWD. Air suspension standard. TDI requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Touareg article, January 2025 revision.

Compact convertible coupe with retractable hardtop. 2.0L turbo four-cylinder. FWD. Automatic or DSG dual-clutch transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Eos article, January 2025 revision.
